measured_by: two multiple-choice comprehension items per graph
justification: "We measured graph comprehension using two items per graph"

measured_by: confidence rating scale (25 %–100 %) combined with comprehension score alignment
justification: "Awareness of graph comprehension was measured by assessing the relationship between confidence in graph comprehension and the graph comprehension score… participants indicated their confidence… with four response options: 25 %, 50 %, 75 % or 100 %."

measured_by: 0–100 concentration slider ('How much did you need to concentrate to understand this figure?')
justification: "Participants rated… the cognitive load required for processing the graph ('How much did you need to concentrate to understand this figure?') on a scale of 0 (a little) to 100 (a lot)."
"Participants rated their climate change risk perceptions on a scale from 0-100… 'what is your take on the seriousness of the threat of climate change?'"

measured_by: three-item Schwartz et al. (1997) numeracy scale
justification: "Numeracy was measured with three items in Study 1 based on previous work by Schwartz and colleagues (1997)."

measured_by: single satisfaction item with five options (0 %–100 %)
justification: "We assessed graph satisfaction ('How satisfied are you with this graph?') with five response options: 0 %, 25 %, 50 %, 75 % or 100 %."

measured_by: single familiarity question (yes / no / I am not sure)
justification: "We asked participants if they were familiar with the graph… with answer options: yes, no, I am not sure."
